[[Ohio State Buckeyes women's ice hockey|Women's ice hockey]]: 1999âpresent| seating_capacity = 1,415 (hockey){{cite press release | title =Women's Hockey Quick Facts | publisher =Ohio State University Department of Athletics | url =http://graphics.fansonly.com/photos/schools/osu/sports/w-hockey/auto_pdf/quick-facts.pdf | accessdate =2006-07-31}}}} The '''OSU Ice Rink''' is a 1,000 seat hockey rink located at [[Ohio State University]] in [[Columbus, Ohio]], United States. The rink was built in 1961, and houses the [[Ohio State Buckeyes women's ice hockey]] team and the [[Ohio State Buckeyes men's ice hockey]] team. The men's hockey team occupied the facility from 1963 until 1998, when the [[Value City Arena]] was completed.{{cite news |first =Craig |last =Merz |title =Curtain falls on old rink |publisher =Columbus Dispatch |page =12H |date =1998-12-04 |accessdate =2006-07-31 }} A 1999 renovation brought the rink to full [[National Hockey League|NHL]] dimensions and improved the facilities. The rink is located adjacent to the east side of [[St. John Arena]] on Woody Hayes Drive, just north of [[Ohio Stadium]]. In 2007, the men's Buckeye hockey team played three preliminary-round [[Central Collegiate Hockey Association|CCHA]] tournament games at the Ice Rink due to scheduling conflicts with the OHSAA Wrestling Tournament at Value City Arena.
